intro: Astragalus chuckwallae, commonly known as Chuckwalla's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow or pale purple flowers. The plant is typically found in arid and semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and desert plains. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small insects and animals. Astragalus chuckwallae is also of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to harsh environmental conditions.
